curam.util.security

Interface UserScope


  • public interface UserScope
    UserScope interface. Currently the user type (internal/external) is determined based on whether the user exists in the security cache or not. If the user exists in the Curam security cache, they are considered an internal user. If they do not exist in the cache, they are considered an external user and as such the implementation of curam.util.security.ExternalAccessSecurity will be used. As a result of this behavior all users, internal and external, must always be unique. This class provides a hook point allowing you to implement your own logic for determining if a user is internal or external, thus providing the possibility of having an internal and external user with the same username. To use your custom implementation, you should set the 'curam.custom.userscope.implementation' application property to be the fully qualified classname of the custom implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isUserExternal(java.lang.String username)
      The implementation of this method should determine the type of User that is logged into the application.

    • Method Detail

      • isUserExternal

        boolean isUserExternal(java.lang.String username)
                throws AppException,
                       InformationalException
        The implementation of this method should determine the type of User that is logged into the application. There are 2 types of users: INTERNAL and EXTERNAL. If the user is an EXTERNAL user, then this method should return true. If false is returned, then the user is considered INTERNAL.
        Parameters:
        username - - The username.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of true indicating an EXTERNAL user, false indicates an INTERNAL user.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic Exception Signature.
        InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
